speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: Evidence still exists.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: High-containment facility, Fort Marlene, Maryland.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do they have there?

speaker: DEEP THROAT
line: The wellspring, Miss Scully-- the original tissue.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'm standing in a train car just like the one on your alien autopsy video. Only I realize that I've been here before.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is where they brought me. This is where they put the implant in my neck in one of these cars.

speaker: MULDER
line: They've been doing experiments since World War II-- tests on innocent civilians-- trying to make an alien/human hybrid.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Cassandra Spender.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: I have been a multiple abductee for many years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I learned about you from your son.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Jeffrey.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Who are you?

speaker: CSM
line: I'm your father.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Hear this, Agent Mulder. There is a war raging. Unless you pull your head out of the sand, you and I and over five billion other people are going to go the way of the dinosaur.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Now is a time of war and stress among the alien nations. The different races, they're in upheaval.

speaker: ELDER
line: What the hell is he?

speaker: WELL MANICURED MAN
line: An alien rebel. He's a resistance fighter.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: The facial scars appear to be protection.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: Protection against what?

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: Infection by the black oil.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: They're going to be calling me. I can feel it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! Cassandra! They're taking her.

speaker: DOCTOR 1
line: Dr. Openshaw, congratulations. Your work-- it's completed. You should see her.

speaker: DOCTOR 1
line: 25 years... she must seem like an old friend.

speaker: DR OPENSHAW
line: Yes.

speaker: DOCTOR 1
line: We're, uh... going out to celebrate. If you'd like to come...

speaker: DR OPENSHAW
line: No. You go on ahead.

speaker: CSM
line: This is the end. I never thought I'd hear myself say those words after all these years. You put your life into something... build it, protect it... The end is as unimaginable as your own death or the death of your children. I could never have scripted the events that led us to this. None of us could. All the brilliant men... the secret that we kept so well. It happened simply, like this. We had a perfect conspiracy with an alien race. Aliens who were coming to reclaim this planet and to destroy all human life. Our job was to secretly prepare the way for their invasion. To create for them a slave race of human/alien hybrids. They were good plans... right plans. Kept secret for over 50 years, ever since the crash at Roswell. Kept secret from men like Fox Mulder. Plans that would have worked had not a rebel alien race come to destroy them. Had not my own son chosen betrayal. Or chosen to betray more wisely.

speaker: SPENDER
line: AD Skinner â€¦. I... I didn't hear the elevator. I was working here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Working on what, Agent Spender?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Progress report on the X-Files.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Progress report to who?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Just to file.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I wasn't aware that you'd made any progress. In the months since your assignment, I've received but one memorandum. Are you planning to hit me all at once?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Uh, it's been slow going.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Truth is your purpose here is not to make any progress, isn't it? Truth is you have no interest in the X-Files. Beyond a certain... personal case. Your mother's abduction.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Alleged abduction.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's what I'm here about.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What happened here?

speaker: SKINNER
line: No one knows yet. A group of people were burned alive here. Another man's on life support. Only your mother survived.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Where is she? Where is she?

speaker: SKINNER
line: They've got her outside.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Mom? Mom... It's me, Jeffrey. Mom, what happened to you? You've been gone so long I thought I'd never see you again.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Oh... Don't cry, honey.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Where have you been?

speaker: SPENDER
line: What did they do to you?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: I need to talk to someone.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You can tell me.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: I need to speak to Agent Mulder.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I don't want him talking with her.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Why?

speaker: SPENDER
line: He's forbidden from the X-Files. He's to stay out of this.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She's asking for him.

speaker: SPENDER
line: She's my mother.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What are you afraid of, Agent Spender?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Of Agent Mulder filling her head with alien-abduction nonsense.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Are you afraid of the truth?

speaker: SPENDER
line: I want to know who did this to her and why. That's all I want.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then why not use every resource available to you?

speaker: SPENDER
line: I'll send you a progress report.

speaker: CSM
line: My son refused to believe that his mother had been abducted... though it had been going on for years. Even after I schemed to put him in charge of the X-Files where Fox Mulder had amassed so much evidence of our secret plans he still couldn't bring himself to accept the possibility of alien life. When he did... come to believe... when the facts became so glaring he turned... not to me, his father, but to the man I'd ruined. The man I'd chosen for him to replace.

speaker: BASKETBALL PLAYER
line: Hey, Milk, let's play ball.

speaker: BASKETBALL PLAYER
line: Yo, Homestyle, cough up the rock.

speaker: SECOND BASKETBAL PLAYER
line: Got Nick over here?

speaker: THIRD BASKETBALL PLAYER
line: Yeah, yeah, I got Nick!

speaker: MULDER
line: Game.

speaker: BASKETBALL PLAYER
line: Oh, no, no. Aw, it don't work like that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Homegirl, word up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder it's my distinct impression that you just cheated. And that you're not coming in again today.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, Scully, I got game.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, you got so much game I'm wondering if you have any work left in you.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm ready to J-O-B just not on some jagoff shoeshine tip.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No "jagoff shoeshine tip"?

speaker: MULDER
line: No background checkin' jagoff shoeshine tip.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, about your J-O-B, Mulder somebody's been trying very hard to reach you by phone. Somebody who wants you back at the FBI ASAP.

speaker: MULDER
line: About what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: About an X-File.

speaker: MULDER
line: You looking for work, Agent Spender? 'Cause if you are, I got a whole pile in that middle drawer that I'd love to shove down someone's throat.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I was just writing you a note. I think you know why I'm here.

speaker: MULDER
line: They found your mother.

speaker: SPENDER
line: She wants to talk to you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't hear the magic word.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Look, Agent Mulder I'm not going to get down on my knees here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you asking me, Agent Spender?

speaker: SPENDER
line: My mother's been gone for almost a year. She turns up in a train car where she's been operated on by a group of doctors who were burned alive. I just want the truth.

speaker: MULDER
line: The truth is out there, Agent Spender. Maybe you should find it for yourself.

speaker: DR. OPENSHAW
line: I expected you sooner.

speaker: CSM
line: I've been at the train yard. I'm trying to tidy things up.

speaker: DR. OPENSHAW
line: The overkill will be hard to divert attention from. But not as hard as from Cassandra. You have no idea, do you? Cassandra is a success.

speaker: CSM
line: No, she can't be. Not now.

speaker: DR. OPENSHAW
line: I had prepared a syringe for her as agreed. But the rebels came.

speaker: CSM
line: They saved her to expose us.

speaker: DR. OPENSHAW
line: She's the key to everything.

speaker: CSM
line: I won't let her out of our hands.

speaker: DR. OPENSHAW
line: They will run medical tests on her. It's only a matter of time. Cassandra must be terminated.

speaker: DR. OPENSHAW
line: They will come and question me.

speaker: CSM
line: I know. I'm sorry.

speaker: DR. OPENSHAW
line: A man should never live long enough to see his children or his work destroyed.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: Hello.

speaker: CSM
line: Have you heard the news?

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: No.

speaker: CSM
line: The rebels have struck.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: Where?

speaker: CSM
line: In Virginia. During one of our medical procedures. They killed the project doctors. Burned them.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: All of them?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes. Dr. Openshaw died in the hyperbaric chamber this evening.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: My god.

speaker: CSM
line: I've called an emergency meeting of the Syndicate. Only the future rides on our response.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: I'll be on a plane.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: Dr. Openshaw?

speaker: MAN WHO LOOKS LIKE DR. OPENSHAW
line: I've come to see you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Didn't expect to find you here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where did you expect to find me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought Agent Spender offered you an X-File assignment.

speaker: MULDER
line: It wasn't exactly an offer.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But isn't it just the opportunity you've been waiting for?

speaker: MULDER
line: It is an opportunity made to order for the powers that be.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think it's a setup?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is exactly the kind of mistake they've been waiting for to come down on me full force.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But Agent Spender asked you.

speaker: MULDER
line: LIKE I SAID: not exactly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We've seen this before. Bodies set aflame with no conclusive cause of combustion. Mulder...

speaker: MULDER
line: I know.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was with Cassandra Spender when she disappeared. You sat with me while I was under hypnosis when I spoke of just these sorts of details.

speaker: MULDER
line: I have no doubt that what Cassandra would tell us would expose more than just what happened to her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was taken to one of those train cars. I was tested, just like Cassandra. What if what she tells us could expose who did this to me? Mulder, Agent Spender doesn't have to know.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Oh, my god. My god...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cassandra.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Oh, Dana. Oh, my god.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's so good to see you. We're old friends. If I can get ahold of a wheelchair you want to go out for some fresh air?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: I don't need a wheelchair.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: But I am dying for a cigarette.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: It feels so good to walk. The doctors don't know what to say. I told them they wouldn't believe how it happened and they wouldn't. No, I'm not going to tell anybody this time because nobody believes you anyway. They want to hear it but they just think you're crazy. I guess I wouldn't believe it either except that it happened to me. No, I'm only going to tell somebody I can trust and who can do something about it. I was hoping when I saw you that Agent Mulder was going to be coming in the door behind you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've got a surprise for you, Cassandra.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Shh. Shhh. Shhhh.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Oh, my god. Oh, my god, I think I'm going to pee the floor.

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't... don't do that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look at you.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: I told you about their power. You said you didn't believe it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I had reasons for doubt when I met you, Cassandra.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: You just doubted yourself. You were just doubting you'd ever see her again, weren't you? Your sister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Agent Mulder told me he believed he saw his sister... last year.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: That wasn't her, Agent Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then where is she?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Out there, with them. The aliens.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cassandra, you were found in a train car. You'd been operated on by doctors.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Yes, that's right.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And these are the doctors who cured you?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: No. The aliens cured me. The doctors were working with the aliens. That's what I wanted to tell you.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: I told you that the aliens were here to do good and that I was being used as an oracle to spread the word. Only now I know what the aliens are here for and it isn't good.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are they here for?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: To wipe us off the planet. They're taking over the universe. They're infecting all other life-forms with a black substance called Purity. It's their life force. It's what they're made of.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the virus-- the black oil.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But, Cassandra, the doctors weren't infected. They were burned.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: By another race of aliens. A rebel force that are mutilating their faces so that they won't be infected. This is what I couldn't tell my son Jeffrey.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why couldn't you tell Jeffrey?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Because he doesn't believe me... even though his life is in danger by these same rebel aliens.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Spender's life's in danger?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: He's in with the men that have been working with the alien colonists for 50 years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Working to do what?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Whatever it is they did to me... and to you, Dana.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you know who these men are?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Oh, sure. One of them's my ex-husband... Jeffrey's father.

speaker: CSM
line: She'd begun to figure it out. Cassandra was beginning to realize her role in the greatest science project that man had ever known. She was the center of 50 years of work... The key to all of our plans... something even my colleagues didn't realize yet. I killed to keep them unknowing. I killed Dr. Openshaw so they wouldn't discover her. When it's Cassandra I should have killed... Cassandra who needed to die. I couldn't do it. With all the blood on my hands I couldn't kill the mother of my own son, a woman I never even loved. My colleagues never knew, focused as they were on the new threat-- the faceless alien rebels who'd burned our doctors alive... But my colleagues had become old men blind to the fact that the faceless rebels already held the upper hand... that they'd used their powers of disguise to infiltrate our group.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Rebels have attacked and burned project facilities in New Mexico and the Southwest. The medical staff at our Arizona research facility's been slain. The train-car deaths cost us. Work on the human/alien hybrids will suffer the death of Dr. Openshaw.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: What do they want?

speaker: CSM
line: To expose our enterprise-everything we've worked for.

speaker: THIRD ELDER
line: Well, some hotshot reporter's going to put the pieces together not to mention law enforcement.

speaker: CSM
line: We have our control on the federal agencies. Our new man at the FBI's very capable of diverting attention.

speaker: MAN WHO LOOKS LIKE THE SECOND ELDER
line: Why not side with the rebels... join their alien resistance?

speaker: THIRD ELDER
line: It's an option.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It's an option you declined long ago. Resistance was futile then. Why would it be any less so now? That's why you voted against it-- against men like Bill Mulder. Collaboration has allowed you to prepare... to stall colonization. I mean, how close are you to developing a human/alien hybrid? That alone ensures your survival.

speaker: MAN WHO LOOKS LIKE THE SECOND ELDER
line: As slave laborers for the aliens.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: What about your vaccine? By collaborating, you bought yourself time to secretly develop a way to combat the aliens-- to fight the future.

speaker: CSM
line: Alex, enough! For 50 years, we've worked on this project-- 50 years since Roswell. We can't sacrifice ourselves for every new threat can we now?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why risk getting caught here?

speaker: MULDER
line: They're going to be monitoring any work on our machines, in or out. We need access to files. And a name that'll raise flags.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe she was making it all up.

speaker: MULDER
line: Smokey's got a name.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Get up from the desk. Get up, turn the computer off, grab whatever you took or printed out and give it to me. Let's go, Agents. They're coming.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Just go.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Assistant Director. I'll assume you came down to apprehend these agents for unauthorized entry into my office. I'll make sure it's duly noted in the report of their dismissal.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I've done as you've asked. Mulder's been brought up to his superiors. He and his partner will be processed out of the FBI. I've done as you've asked. Now, I would like you to do for me.

speaker: CSM
line: Do for you?

speaker: SPENDER
line: I think I'm entitled.

speaker: SPENDER
line: The truth. The truth about my mother. She won't tell me.

speaker: CSM
line: Because you won't believe her. Maybe you won't believe me. Maybe it's better not to know.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Look, I need to know.

speaker: CSM
line: You need to show me that you're capable of handling the responsibility that comes with this knowledge.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Don't try me, old man.

speaker: CSM
line: I gave you responsibility. I gave you a position. I gave you the things that you couldn't get yourself and you can't do the job!

speaker: SPENDER
line: Keeping Fox Mulder down is not a job. It's your dirty work!

speaker: CSM
line: You pale to Fox Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I bet you're curious about C.G.B.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: C.G.B. Spender-- his name. Cigarette-Smoking Man?

speaker: MULDER
line: What's it stand for?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's an alias, as far as I can figure. One of hundreds.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, you want to go one-on-one? We got nothing but time now that we're on administrative leave.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Aren't you curious what I've got in the box? Everything I could find on him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nothing you could ever find would be accurate or credible.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe. But there's a picture you're going to want to see.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's C.G.B. Spender and my father.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was taken in 1973. I traced the connection to something they worked on together for 25 years at the state department. A highly classified project. There's more, if you're ready. Cassandra Spender is, indeed, the mother of Agent Jeffery Spender and the ex-wife of C.G.B. Spender. But there's something that you're going to be surprised to find out. She was first abducted in 1973 on the night of November 27.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's the same night as my sister.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And there are other names connected to C.G.B. Spender and your father-- Ph.D.s., doctors... one a Nobel winner for early works in genetics. A Dr. Eugene Openshaw. He was the doctor that was found amongst the burn victims clinging to life beside Cassandra Spender. He died the next day in the hospital before he was questioned.

speaker: MULDER
line: The project is still going on.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: CSM
line: If Mulder hadn't known of his father's history with me he was fueled now with names and dates and... certainties. I couldn't stop him any longer-- stop him from learning our sins. His father's and my own. The truth was out there fatally exposed. I had one last hope. One chance to preserve my legacy.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I waited, like you asked.

speaker: CSM
line: Good. I'm pleased. I was doubtful after our last meeting.

speaker: SPENDER
line: You have a new job for me?

speaker: CSM
line: Yes. I may have been unduly harsh. You deserve a fighting chance to prove your father wrong.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What is it?

speaker: CSM
line: A weapon.

speaker: CSM
line: A man has infiltrated the group that I work with. That's to kill him.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I don't understand.

speaker: CSM
line: He's pretending to be a member of our group disguising himself as a man he's already killed. You will greet him as that man. Engage him in conversation. Then put that in the back of his neck. You can do it, Jeffrey.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Watch where you point that.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Sir, my name is Jeffrey Spender. My father sent me to see you.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I have a message from the group.

speaker: MAN WHO LOOKS LIKE THE SECOND ELDER
line: They've changed their minds?

speaker: SPENDER
line: That's what I'm here about.

speaker: MAN WHO LOOKS LIKE THE SECOND ELDER
line: Sit. Please. What have you to tell me?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Something I've been entrusted with. It's, uh, it's a name, actually-- one that will have meaning for you.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Thanks for coming. I know it's late and you've been forbidden to have any contact with us.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You say Cassandra Spender's life is in danger.

speaker: MULDER
line: Her life's been in danger going on 30 years... just not the way I think it is now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: In danger from who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Men who've conducted medical experiments in what began as a secret government project but what is now the most private global enterprise.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Enterprising to do what?

speaker: MULDER
line: To develop alien/human hybrids that will survive the viral apocalypse when aliens colonize the earth.

speaker: SKINNER
line: And I suppose you have proof of this?

speaker: MULDER
line: Files that Agent Scully dug up that make all the right connections to Dr. Eugene Openshaw to my sister, to my father... to Agent Spender's father.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Spender's father?

speaker: MULDER
line: The Smoking Man.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What?!

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's true, sir. We have documented evidence.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then you believe this, Agent Scully? This whole account?

speaker: MULDER
line: I know that Agent Scully has her doubts about the purposes of these experiments but I also know that she herself believes she was a test subject when she was abducted four years ago.

speaker: SKINNER
line: If Cassandra Spender's life was in danger, why not Scully's?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because I believe Cassandra Spender represents the final stages of these experiments-- that she may very well be the first successful alien/human hybrid.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What I don't understand is if she was a success, then why is her life threatened?

speaker: MULDER
line: Because... the men who created her would rather kill her than let her expose the enterprise.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She's under 24-hour guard.

speaker: MULDER
line: Assigned by Agent Spender?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You've never seen one before, have you?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: It's shocking at first. The acceptance of the idea, it's... It's something you thought only children and fools believed in. It undermines your beliefs-- in yourself, in the world... but then you come to understand.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Understand what?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Well, the responsibility that this knowledge demands but the men who have it. The great sacrifice by great men like your father.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What sacrifice?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: The sacrifice of your mother.

speaker: SPENDER
line: What do you know about that?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Just that she's... been the subject of an experiment for 25 years.

speaker: SPENDER
line: My father's involved in that? Is he?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Your father directs the experiments.

speaker: SPENDER
line: So... I'm protecting her now so the experiments can continue?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: That's why he put you on the X-Files. That's why your father sent you here tonight. You're protecting the project, Jeff. Making the sacrifices. So that you can be a great man, too.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I'll be my own great man.

speaker: CSM
line: I've trusted no one. Treachery is the inevitable result of all affairs. Every man believes he has his own good reason. I have little doubt of my son's disloyalty to me. Certainly he led Mulder and Scully to us. His mother must know by now her central role in the grand plan... That's she's as much alien as human. Do you wonder why I've chosen you? You've never betrayed me. Now I need someone to trust.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: I'll help you. It's not too late.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Cassandra? Ms. Spender?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Where's my mother?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You tell me, Agent Spender.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Where's the guard? I had a guard posted here.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I got here and she was gone.

speaker: SPENDER
line: He took her.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Spender?

speaker: MULDER
line: Cassandra?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: I can't believe I found you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you find us? Cassandra?

speaker: MULDER
line: How did you get here? How did you get out of your room?

speaker: SCULLY
line: How did you get your clothes?

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: Oh, Agent Scully, Agent Mulder you cannot let them find me.

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: You cannot let them have me!

speaker: MULDER
line: Let go!

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: You have got to kill me now!

speaker: CASSANDRA SPENDER
line: If you don't kill me, it all starts. There won't be any stopping it. I am the one. You have to shoot me... Please!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Stand away, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder! Mulder, we have to protect her.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder? Mulder!
